method: In a large pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the chopped cactus, minced garlic, cumin, chili powder, paprika, salt, and pepper to the pan.
Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the cactus is tender.
In a separate bowl, mix the flour, baking powder, salt, and water to make the taco shell batter.
Heat vegetable oil in a small skillet over medium heat.
Pour 1/4 cup of the batter into the skillet and cook until golden brown on both sides.
Repeat with the remaining batter to make the taco shells.
To serve, fill each taco shell with the cooked cactus mixture.
Top with diced tomatoes, shredded lettuce, diced avocado, shredded cheese, lime juice, chopped cilantro, sour cream, and hot sauce.
